p: It was also in the mid-1990s that Djobel villagers began asking the state regional administration to help them take possession of their upland territory, which was being planted with cashew trees by some Arame villagers (after they had filled their own upland with cashew trees). In addition, women in Djobel were prevented from collecting the roofing straw from their own upland and from fetching drinking water from one Arame well (after finding that feces had been thrown into it), and thus forced to go to further away to fulfil these vital needs.
